channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: India Remains A Very Strategic Ally In Asia Pacific: US

media:content.media:description: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said that Trump has very good relationship with PM Modi.

item.description: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt stated the strong personal relationship between US President Donald Trump and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
item.content:encoded: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt stated the strong personal relationship between US President Donald Trump and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

item.title: Netanyahu To Meet Trump Next Week As Gaza Truce Pressure Mounts

media:content.media:description: Netanyahu became the first foreign leader to visit Trump in his second term in February. (File Photo)

item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will visit the White House next week for talks with President Donald Trump, a US official said Monday, as Washington ramps up the pressure for a ceasefire in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will visit the White House next week for talks with President Donald Trump, a US official said Monday, as Washington ramps up the pressure for a ceasefire in Gaza.

item.title: Over 14 Million People Could Die From US Foreign Did Cuts: Report

media:content.media:description: Over 14 million of the world's most vulnerable people could die because Trump is dismantling foreign aid.

item.description: More than 14 million of the world's most vulnerable people, a third of them small children, could die because of the Trump administration's dismantling of US foreign aid, a study in the Lancet journal projected Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: More than 14 million of the world's most vulnerable people, a third of them small children, could die because of the Trump administration's dismantling of US foreign aid, a study in the Lancet journal projected Tuesday.

item.title: Trump Signs Order Lifting Sanctions On Syria

media:content.media:description: Trump signed on Monday an executive order terminating a U.S. sanctions program on Syria.

item.description: Donald Trump signed an executive order terminating a US sanctions program on Syria, allowing an end to the country's isolation from international financial system and building on Washington's pledge to help it rebuild after a devastating civil war.
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump signed an executive order terminating a US sanctions program on Syria, allowing an end to the country's isolation from international financial system and building on Washington's pledge to help it rebuild after a devastating civil war.

item.title: Trump Administration Threatens New Harvard Cuts Over Jewish Right

media:content.media:description: Harvard has been at the forefront of Donald Trump's campaign against top US universities.

item.description: The Trump administration on Monday accused Harvard of violating the civil rights of its Jewish and Israeli students and threatened to cut off all federal funding if the university does not take urgent action.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration on Monday accused Harvard of violating the civil rights of its Jewish and Israeli students and threatened to cut off all federal funding if the university does not take urgent action.

item.title: What Is "Scarf Challenge"? 12-Year-Old In UK Reportedly Dies Attempting A Dare
item.description: The family is urging other parents to be vigilant about their children's online activities.
item.content:encoded: The family is urging other parents to be vigilant about their children's online activities.

item.title: Harvard Violated Civil Rights of Jewish, Israeli Students, Trump Officials Say
item.description: The Trump administration said a US investigation found that Harvard University violated civil rights law in its treatment of Jewish and Israeli students, further endangering federal funding for the school.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration said a US investigation found that Harvard University violated civil rights law in its treatment of Jewish and Israeli students, further endangering federal funding for the school.

item.title: 'Not Talking To Them Since We...': Trump Says Not Open To An Deal With Iran

media:content.media:description: "I am not offering Iran ANYTHING, unlike Obama," Trump wrote on his Truth Social platform.

item.description: US President Donald Trump said Monday he was not offering Iran anything nor talking to it "since we totally obliterated" the country's nuclear facilities.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump said Monday he was not offering Iran anything nor talking to it "since we totally obliterated" the country's nuclear facilities.

item.title: "When Terrorism Is Supported By State Against...": S Jaishankar At UN

media:content.media:description: "Any state sponsorship must be exposed," he said.

item.description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said it is imperative to call out terrorism publicly when it is supported by a state against a neighbour and is fuelled by the bigotry of extremism, a strong reference to Pakistan.
item.content:encoded: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said it is imperative to call out terrorism publicly when it is supported by a state against a neighbour and is fuelled by the bigotry of extremism, a strong reference to Pakistan.

item.title: "Go Back To Third World": Republican On Video Of Zohran Mamdani Eating With Hands
item.description: Republican Representative Brandon Gill has told Zohran Mamdani to "go back to the third world" after an old video of the New York City mayoral candidate eating rice with his hands surfaced online.
item.content:encoded: Republican Representative Brandon Gill has told Zohran Mamdani to "go back to the third world" after an old video of the New York City mayoral candidate eating rice with his hands surfaced online.

item.title: Southern Europe Roasts As Temperatures Soar
item.description: Spain and Portugal reported record temperatures as Italy and France braced for several more days of a punishing heatwave that has gripped southern Europe and Britain, sparking health and wildfire warnings.
item.content:encoded: Spain and Portugal reported record temperatures as Italy and France braced for several more days of a punishing heatwave that has gripped southern Europe and Britain, sparking health and wildfire warnings.

item.title: US To Revoke Visas For Glastonbury Band Over Anti-Israel Chant
item.description: The United States said it was revoking visas for the British punk-rap group Bob Vylan, which led a chant at the Glastonbury festival calling for death to the Israeli military.
item.content:encoded: The United States said it was revoking visas for the British punk-rap group Bob Vylan, which led a chant at the Glastonbury festival calling for death to the Israeli military.

item.title: Meta, TikTok Can Be Sued By Mother Of New York Teen Killed While 'Subway Surfing'
item.description: Meta Platforms and TikTok owner ByteDance must face a wrongful death lawsuit by the mother of a 15-year-old Manhattan boy who died while "subway surfing" on a moving train, a New York state judge ruled.
item.content:encoded: Meta Platforms and TikTok owner ByteDance must face a wrongful death lawsuit by the mother of a 15-year-old Manhattan boy who died while "subway surfing" on a moving train, a New York state judge ruled.

item.title: Elk Roams Into Cafe-Packed Street In Central Stockholm
item.description: Early risers in Stockholm glimpsed an unusual sight when an elk strayed into the city centre and roamed a street of popular eateries before being put down, police said.
item.content:encoded: Early risers in Stockholm glimpsed an unusual sight when an elk strayed into the city centre and roamed a street of popular eateries before being put down, police said.

item.title: Thousands In Norway Mistakenly Told They Won Big On Lottery
item.description: A Norwegian lottery company apologised to 47,000 crestfallen gamblers who were mistakenly told they had won huge sums in a lottery, the firm blaming a currency conversion error.
item.content:encoded: A Norwegian lottery company apologised to 47,000 crestfallen gamblers who were mistakenly told they had won huge sums in a lottery, the firm blaming a currency conversion error.

item.title: After Op Sindoor, Jaish Swimming Pool To Train Terrorists Reopened: Sources

media:content.media:description: The terrorists involved in 2019 Pulwama attack even clicked a picture in the swimming pool.

item.description: Over a month ago, on May 7, India struck terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir to avenge the Pahalgam attacks.
item.content:encoded: Over a month ago, on May 7, India struck terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir to avenge the Pahalgam attacks.

item.title: How Rise Of Zohran Mamdani Is Dividing Democrats
item.description: Zohran Mamdani's campaign focused on affordability, with policy goals including a rent freeze, free buses, and universal childcare.
item.content:encoded: Zohran Mamdani's campaign focused on affordability, with policy goals including a rent freeze, free buses, and universal childcare.

item.title: Wildfires Burn In Turkey And France As Early Heatwave Hits

media:content.media:description: Experts are most concerned about the heat implications on elders, babies, labourers, and the poor.

item.description: Firefighters battled wildfires in Turkey and France as an early heatwave hit the region.
item.content:encoded: Firefighters battled wildfires in Turkey and France as an early heatwave hit the region.

item.title: BBC Regrets Not Stopping Glastonbury Livestream Of Bob Vylan

media:content.media:description: The BBC issued a warning on screen while the set was being streamed online.

item.description: Britain's BBC said it regretted not stopping the livestream of punk-rap duo Bob Vylan's set at Glastonbury after the performance included chants against the Israeli military, drawing condemnation from British Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
item.content:encoded: Britain's BBC said it regretted not stopping the livestream of punk-rap duo Bob Vylan's set at Glastonbury after the performance included chants against the Israeli military, drawing condemnation from British Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.title: Diplomatic Talks Cannot Resume Unless US Rules Out Further Strikes: Iran

media:content.media:description: Iranian Minister Takht-Ravanchi also said Iran should still be allowed to enrich uranium.

item.description: Diplomatic talks between Washington and Tehran cannot resume unless the US rules out further strikes on Iran, its deputy foreign minister told the BBC late Sunday.
item.content:encoded: Diplomatic talks between Washington and Tehran cannot resume unless the US rules out further strikes on Iran, its deputy foreign minister told the BBC late Sunday.
